page.title: 09NARROW GAUGE RAILWAY:History
page.content:
The Leighton Buzzard{Light Railway used to start at Double Arches quarries near Heath & Reach and ended at Pratt's Pitt 4 miles away to the south in Leighton.
The formal opening took place on November 20th 1919. In the late 1940's there were up to 500 wagons daily making up some 20 trains.
Between the two wars some Belgian and Japanese wagons were used. The railway company owned no rolling stock of its own. The traffic was carried in wagons owned by the individual quarry companies.
The commonest wagon used was the side tipper. It had the capacity of 1 cubic yard (25 cwt of sand). (more)
